page.title: 13John O'Gaunts
page.content: The area takes its name from associations with the medieval magnate {John O'Gaunt.}However, the area is very much a product of the 19th and 20th centuries. To the north-east of the{A639 Pontefract Road}the area consists of a mixture of{privately {owned houses}and{council houses.}To the south-west of the road the buildings are mainly{factories}and {warehouses,}doubtless attracted by easy access to the national motorway network. John O'Gaunts stands on high ground overlooking the valley of the {River Aire}and it is possible to obtain good views of the area of the survey. The most prominent features are the{Yorkshire Imperial Metals factory,{Skelton Grange power station and{Temple Newsam}park.
